question: How is hunting access affected by the CAP canal near the Picacho Mountains?
generated_answer: Hunting access near the Picacho Mountains is somewhat restricted due to the C.A.P. canal. Hunters can gain access from the east on Deep Well Ranch Road, from the west by Houser Road from Highway 87, and from the south on Pecan Road. However, the C.A.P. canal along the west and south side of Newman Peak limits access. Additionally, the railroad crossing is blocked about 3 miles north of the Picacho Dairy Queen along the I-10 frontage road, further affecting access.
ground_truth_answer: Access is somewhat restricted by the C.A.P. canal along the west and south side of Newman Peak. However, hunters are allowed to walk through the culverts and over the bridge crossings to hunt the east and north sides of the CAP canal.
